marketNews.title: US Involvement in Israel-Iran Conflict Determined Within 2 Weeks
marketNews.content: White House spokesperson Karoline Leavitt said on Thursday (June 19) that U.S. President Donald Trump will decide within the next two weeks whether to attack Iran. The statement delivered via Leavitt was softer than Trump's earlier remarks, which had named Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei as an "easy target" and urged Iranian citizens to evacuate. Leavitt's comment came a day after the Wall Street Journal reported that Trump had told senior officials this week that he approved a plan to strike Iran. However, the Wall Street Journal source said Trump is still delaying the attack to see if the Iranian government will halt its nuclear program. The Israel-Iran conflict has entered its eighth day, with neither side showing signs of a cease-fire. In response, foreign ministers of the United Kingdom, France, Germany and the EU foreign policy chief are scheduled to meet Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi in Geneva on Friday (June 20) to try to de-escalate the conflict. British Foreign Minister David Lammy said the next two weeks represent the last diplomatic window to prevent a wider escalation in the Middle East. Meanwhile, Russia and China publicly condemned Israel and called for immediate de-escalation. Key Takeaway: The two-week deadline set by Trump eases concerns of immediate U.S. military involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict. In response, Brent futures for September 2025 fell 2.04% to about $75.5 per barrel in intraday trading on Friday (June 20), although they are up 3.7% over the past week. Equity markets reacted mixed: Nikkei -0.22%, EURO STOXX 50 +0.8%, S&P Futures -0.28%. The Indonesian composite index (IHSG) fell another 0.88% today after a 1.96% drop yesterday, indicating profit-taking amid rising geopolitical uncertainty.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content:
1. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said the government hopes Indonesia can sign a free trade agreement this year with the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) led by Russia, aiming to boost demand for Indonesian export commodities such as CPO, coffee and natural rubber. The EAEU consists of five members: Armenia, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan and Russia.
2. Gaikindo Chairman Yohannes Nangoi said the association and the government are discussing new breakthroughs to stimulate car sales in Indonesia, which could include fiscal incentives or tax reforms, to be announced once agreed.
3. IDX Director Jeffrey Hendrik said the proposal to reopen broker codes and domicile registration has been approved by OJK, with implementation expected in July 2025. The reopening will not be real-time; data will be sent after the first trading session’s break.
4. IDX Director Jeffrey Hendrik also said the exchange is studying a possible adjustment of the stock lot size to improve liquidity and market inclusivity, but implementation will not occur this year.
5. Edgnex Data Centers, a Damac Group digital infrastructure subsidiary, will invest $2.3 billion (approximately IDR 37 trillion) to develop a data center in Indonesia. The project will be built on a 12-hectare site in Cikarang, West Java, with the first phase targeted for completion in 2026 and further development through 2028.
6. Several property developers announced their 5M25 marketing sales: Agung Podomoro Land ($APLN) recorded sales of IDR 638 billion (17% of the 2025 target); Metropolitan Land ($MTLA) recorded sales of IDR 775 billion (39% of target); and Perintis Triniti Properti ($TRIN) recorded sales of IDR 667 billion (37% of target).
7. Cikarang Listrindo ($POWR) established a subsidiary, PT Energi Baik Alami, which will serve as a holding company for renewable energy businesses.

tickerNews.title: Archi Indonesia Controlling Shareholder Rajawali Corpora Puts ARCI Divestment on Hold
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that the controlling shareholder of Archi Indonesia, PT Rajawali Corpora, has halted its plan to sell ARCI shares because the company's financial position improved after gold prices rose. PT Rajawali Corpora holds about 85% of ARCI and, since 2023, Bloomberg reported the conglomerate intended to divest ARCI at a valuation of around $1 billion. Although the plan is paused, Bloomberg said the divestment consideration remains and Rajawali may still decide to sell ARCI shares. Operationally, ARCI targets a 25% year-on-year increase in gold production in 2025 versus the 2024 realization of 93.4 koz.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Resources Awaiting FIRB Approval for Wolfram Limited Acquisition
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources said that the completion of the transaction to acquire Wolfram Limited is still pending approval from the Australian Foreign Investment Review Board (FIRB). Wolfram Limited is a gold and copper mining company. BUMI explained that the acquisition aligns with its transformation plan, as the company is currently launching a diversification program into downstream and critical mineral sectors.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Announces Resignation of Director Sorimuda Pulungan
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa said that Sorimuda Pulungan has submitted his resignation as a director of the company. The resignation will become effective after approval by the General Meeting of Shareholders on June 30, 2025. DEWA noted that Sorimuda will continue to support the company as an advisor.

tickerNews.title: ICBP Approves 2024 Dividend of Approximately IDR 2.9 trillion
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur approved a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 amounting to about IDR 2.9 trillion or IDR 250 per share, representing a dividend payout ratio of roughly 41% (2023: ~33%) and indicating a dividend yield of about 2.4% as of Friday (June 20). Meanwhile, shareholders of Indofood Sukses Makmur ($INDF) approved a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 of about IDR 2.5 trillion or IDR 280 per share, representing a dividend payout ratio of roughly 28% (2023: ~29%) and indicating a dividend yield of about 3.5% as of Friday (June 20). The cum-date and payment dates have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Announces Share Buyback Program of Approximately 320 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Indonesian herbal and pharmaceutical company Sido Muncul announced a buyback program of about 320 million shares (1.1% of total) to be executed between June 23 and September 22, 2025. The estimated funding for the buyback is IDR 192 billion, representing the remaining allocation from the previous buyback announced in March 2025. SIDO also maintains a buyback price ceiling of IDR 760 per share.

tickerNews.title: IPCM Declares 2024 Dividend of Approximately IDR 125.2 billion
tickerNews.content: Jasa Armada Indonesia announced a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of about IDR 125.2 billion, representing a dividend payout ratio of roughly 75% (2023: ~75%). This corresponds to a final dividend of IDR 19.92 per share and indicates a final dividend yield of about 6.8% as of Friday (June 20). The cum-date is on the regular market and negotiation on June 26, 2025, with payment on July 18, 2025. Previously, IPCM distributed an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of IDR 3.8 per share in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: ACES Reports Same-Store Sales Growth Decline in May 2025
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same-store sales growth (SSSG) of -4.6% year-on-year in May 2025 (April 2025: -14.1% YoY, May 2024: +10.1% YoY). This caused 5M25 SSSG to fall -2.7% YoY (5M24: +11.1%), below the 2025 target of over +1% YoY. During 5M25, SSSG contracted across all regions: Outside Java -0.1% YoY, Java outside Jakarta -3.7% YoY, and Jakarta -5.4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DSSA’s Subsidiary Launches Indonesia’s Largest Integrated Solar Panel Plant
tickerNews.content: Dian Swastatika Sentosa, through its subsidiary PT Trina Mas Agra Indonesia, inaugurated Indonesia’s first and largest integrated solar panel factory located in the Kendal Industrial Zone. The plant, with an investment value exceeding IDR 1.5 trillion, has a production capacity of up to 1 GW per year. PT Trina Mas Agra Indonesia is a joint venture between DSSA’s subsidiary PT Daya Sukses Makmur Selaras, Trina Solar Co. Ltd., and PLN.
